main.name: Nischay Thapa
main.description: I enjoy solving business problems that involves consulting, managing, analysing, and generating value out of data
main.contactmessage: If you love data or want to get value out of it, let's talk!

education.description: I completed two years of course work and a research component focusing on clinical natural language processing. Throughout the coursework, I've learned to effectively understand business problems by working backwards, framing them into a data problem and deriving insights, recommendations and machine learning solutions to help businesses achieve their ultimate success. In addition to this, I've developed different solutions in various sectors:
education.first: Participated in IEEE Symposium, presenting a novel framework to identify potential groups for vaccination prioritisation, securing a second runner up position.
education.second: Developed AWS-powered Alexa skills for the Museum of London to efficiently communicate construction reports amongst building and site managers.
education.third: Published a research paper that attempts to solve the hospital readmission problem using clinical admission notes.

education.description: The course was a perfect blend of IT and management. Over the years, I have learned that knowledge of information and technology management benefits significantly to suffice consumer requirements in every perspective, enhancing the performance of the products and services and determining the success of every modern organization.
education.first: Gained exposure in subject areas such as Database Management systems, Mathematics and Statistics, Advance Programming, Data Structures and Algorithms, Software Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Data Mining, Marketing, Economics, Supply Chain and Operations Management.
education.second: Developed a CRM application using the Spring framework for a pharmaceutical company to store customer and prospect contact information, identify sales opportunities, and manage inventories.
education.third: Presented a proof of concept (POC) application to connect backpackers who want to travel to Nepal without the need for a local tourist guide.

work.title: Data Scientist
work.description: Delivered enterprise data lake solution, player performance reporting tool for Golf Australia, improving their analytical capabilities by 80%. Designed an ingestion pattern to fetch data from various social media into the data lake to power marketing analytics for RMIT University. Developed a modular MLOps framework to support real-time inference and batch workloads, monitor concept and data drifts, cloud watch alarms to re-train ML pipelines and feature store using Sagemaker, CodePipeline, API Gateway, Lambda and CDK. Developed an ETL workflow to automate the transformation of deeply nested JSON documents for cataloging in AWS Glue, significantly reducing the effort to analyse the data by the end-user. Re-engineered and automated legacy ingestion and consumption pattern by using AWS Lambdas with a customised R runtime thereby achieving considerable cost saving and improved performance. Used CTEs and advanced analytical functions to chain multiple data sources and identify high potential athletes, improving Athena query performance by 200 seconds while scanning more than 500 GB of data.Developed a curation engine to run multiple Athena queries on a schedule using Eventbridge while storing metadata in DynamoDB, powering more instantaneous reporting capabilities.

work.title: Data Science Intern
work.description: Developed an active learning framework to reduce labelling costs in regression and classification problems for safety and mission-critical systems. Implemented custom query strategies for different learning scenarios, improving model performance by 17% than random selection using only 40% of training data. Built an interactive CT/ CD pipeline using streamlit and mlflow to acquire labels from an oracle, conduct multiple experiments and serve trained models directly into production.

work.company: RMIT Cyber Innovation Challenge | Amazon Web Services
work.title: Digital Innovator
work.description: Developed a minimal loveable product using Amazon Alexa for the Museum of London to communicate forecasted electric consumptions and potential faults in HVAC systems. Worked backwards, building an empathy map of users, highlighted pain points and proposed a solution with a press release, FAQs and a prototype powered by AWS Alexa, Lambda, S3, Kinesis, Sagemaker and Quicksight.

work.company: Creators Institute of Business and Technology
work.title: Data Analyst
work.description: Developed a dashboard using Tableau to highlight KPIs such as the number of customers acquired over a while, revenue growth, and retention rates of the services provided by the institution. Segmented customers based on recency, frequency and monetary values for targeted advertising, improving conversion rate by 15%. Analysed sentiments from reviews, enhancing customer experience and obtaining a satisfaction score of 95%.

work.title: Customer Insights Analyst
work.description: Developed a dashboard using PowerBI highlighting KPI such as prompt time, retention rate and customer satisfaction score from more than 400 thousand retail customers. Segmented customers based on their reported issues over time with a recommendation to assign field visit for maintenance, improving retention rate by 7%. Analysed text-based sentiments from user complaints and ranked high priority customers enhancing satisfaction score by 19%. Led support team as level-three supervisor providing training to more than 150 technical support representatives to maintain call standards.

testimonials.text: Nischay is intelligent, creative and not afraid to take initiative. During his time with us, he actively engaged in team meetings and performed his tasks with strong attention to detail. The field of data science and STEM in general require a curious and explorative mindset, both of which were demonstrated by Nischay. The problem proposed to Nischay required an approach with an open mind. It also demanded teamwork and discussion with both his peers and seniors. He was capable in presenting his ideas to the team as well as receive feedback constructively, making him a good team player, something that PHM Technology values above most traits. I strongly recommend Nischay Bikram Thapa, for any role involving data science or engineering for all the reasons above.
testimonials.user: Navid Zaman | Data Science Lead at PHM Technology

testimonials.text: Nischay is a very capable Data Science professional, he is always available to help and his mentoring skills are exceptional. I have learned a lot from Nischay during my Master in Analytics, I could not be more fortunate to have Nischay as a Mentor. If you are looking for a Data Science professional, I fully recommend Nischay in all areas ( Machine Learning, Python, R, SQL, etc ).
testimonials.user: Victorino Marquez | Sr. Quality Specialist with Minitab and Master Lean Six Sigma Black Belt.

testimonials.text: Nischay is a prominent and valuable team player with remarkable leadership and critical thinking skills. I was impressed by his skills when I appointed him as a data analyst. Later I also allowed him to instruct some of the students interested to learn data science, where he performed exceptionally well. Throughout his tenure, I have always found him innovative, self-motivated, who can perform any task with excellent efficiency. Nischay would be an asset to any company.
testimonials.user: Dixanta Bahadur Shrestha | Owner at Creators Institute of Business and Technology
